topic.title: Seeding
topic.body: I'm running ZeroNet on a server and I'm not impressed by the incoming outgoing data ratio. Is there anyway to increase seeding?

topic.title: ZeroNet + Meshnet
topic.body: Are there any attempts at running Zeronet on a physical Meshnet? Like Hyperboria or just plain CJDNS. That would truly be decentralised and censorship-resistant network

topic.title: Howto retain ZeroID on multible installations
topic.body: How do I reinstall ZeroNet, without losing my ZeroID?

topic.title: Carlsson
topic.body: Han kom som ett yrväder en aprilafton och hade ett höganäskrus i en svångrem om halsen.

2_15EnNiQcFsavvvm7WHt7SCjCv4vV6Gyu7z.body:
> [nofish](#comment_379_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): There is a meshproject that using zeronet:https://github.com/bashrc/freedombone/blob/1b983df895af0bbcb9415dc8f99d041319006eb9/src/freedombone-meshweb

Ah, Freedombone. I knew about that one. I own a BeagleBone and am a great fan of bashrc's work with Freedombone. I used it a bit when it was a lot more simplistic.

Incidentally, I'm running my ZeroNet instance on my BeagleBone, does the job great!

3_15EnNiQcFsavvvm7WHt7SCjCv4vV6Gyu7z.body:
> [nofish](#comment_381_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): backup your data dir (data/user.json to be more specific)

Thanks, any idea on how to do that in an already started docker container?

> [garou](#comment_3_1C6JtzttTcB1nd8Q8JZYDHriciPz3kvLqV): I did running docker exec -i zeronet_docker_name_here /bin/bashand tail -n 100 /root/data/users.jsonso copied manualy...

I just ran 'docker cp containerID /path/to/file /path/on/host' seems to work

> [drapslaget](#comment_3_15EnNiQcFsavvvm7WHt7SCjCv4vV6Gyu7z): I just ran 'docker cp containerID /path/to/file /path/on/host' seems to work

 `docker cp containerID:/path/to/file /path/on/host` is the correct command
